basics.name: Mikael Andersson
basics.label: Senior Lead Software Engineer
basics.summary:
Back-end Software Engineer who enjoys working with users and solving business critical problems. 
Passionate about technology always keeping current and learning new things.

work.name: JPMorgan Chase
work.summary:
Tech lead of the Card Transaction Squad responsible for card transaction orchestration for authorizations, clearing and everything in-between.
The platform consists of about 15 different micro services engineered with resiliency and self healing as a primary concern; leveraging benefits of synchronous and asynchronous processing with API idempotency, retries and observability.
As a Squad Tech Lead I am hands on while also being the main point of contact for the squad, with additional responsibilities such as deep involvement in Project Increment planning, people management and cross team coordination.
We work using two week Sprints and as a Squad Lead I ensure Scrum events are run efficiently and in a way so that the team is in the loop as much as possible of what is going on and jointly shape the backlog both for what's next and what is in the future.
highlights: Tech Lead
Modern JVM tech stack
High throughput distributed platform

work.name: Mercuria Energy Trading
work.summary:
Role spanning multiple business areas; Intermediation desk, compliance, scheduling and data science. 

Working directly with the Intermediation desk ensuring trading and reporting runs smoothly while also working on enabling new business opportunities. 
Ensuring reporting obligations are met for REMIT, FinFrag and MiFID (II). Built REMIT reporting platform and threshold claculations for FinFrag, EMIR and MiFID II.
Establish, educate and assist non-IT employees and data scientists on a set of recommended ways of working on Python solutions. Advanced technical guidance and assistance to desk analysists
highlights: Working closely with users
Vendor software integration
Front Office Desk exposure
Engineering aspects of ML/data science initiatives

work.summary: Joined the Cradle team as a permanent employee where I continued in the same role.
work.name: RBS
work.position: Senior Software Engineer (VP) / Technical hands-on Scrum Master
highlights: Team lead role as technical Scrum Master

work.summary: Technical Scrum Master for one of three distributed scrum teams working on the Credit Risk and Default Loss Estimation (Cradle) application (same application as described below during the period April 2010 â€“ April 2011).
work.name: RBS
work.position: Senior Software Engineer (VP)/ Technical hands-on Scrum Master
highlights: Exciting work on a new Model Server application which support versioned Java calculation models
Regulator mandated changes to insurance, mid corporate and large corporate Probability of Default (PD) Models
LGD calculation methodology changes for facilities secured by guarantees

work.summary: Java developer on a Greenfield risk and valuation service to provide Market Risk users access to data across all their functional IT systems. This will become the bank wide 'Golden Source' for market risk data.The project was managed using the Scrum methodology and developed in Java. The system is essentially an Extraction Transform Load (ETL) framework at its core which will be made up of a large number of feeds which will populate our data mart. The data mart is implemented on SQL Server and designed as a star schema.
work.name: RBC CM
highlights: Greenfield ETL system using Java and the Spring framework

work.summary:
Full stack developer on the Credit Risk And Default Loss Estimation (Cradle) application. Cradle is a service which performs the calculations for other client applications. 
Cradle is also the golden source for Probability of Default and Loss Given Default data, publishing feeds for downstream systems. Clients mainly interact with Cradle using SOAP web service calls. 
Had leading role on a project aimed at modernising the Cradle application, splitting it up into smaller standalone components exposing RESTful APIs. This project was managed using Scrum with two-week Sprints.
work.name: RBS
highlights: First time working with Agile / Scrum
Scorecard grading of clients which calculates a Probability of Default
Loss Given Default model implementation
Risk Adjusted Return On Equity calculations

work.summary:
Worked on an in-house Credit Risk system; a web application used by traders and risk management to monitor and manage the amount of credit related risk. The system deals with counterparty, settlement and issuer risk. 
Application was developed in Java using libraries such as Spring, iBATIS, Struts, JSF, Seam and Facelets and deployed on a JBoss Application Server.
work.name: Dresdner Kleinwort / Commerzbank
highlights: Frequent travel to Frankfurt Germany

work.summary:
At the EBI I worked in the External Services group which provide a wide range of public bioinformatics services. 
Bioinformatics services typically requires a lot of computational resources and one of the main things the team provide is a framework which schedules and executes user submitted jobs on our Linux compute farm. This involves a wide range of technologies e.g. Java, Perl, SOAP, XML, HTML and Unix.
work.name: EBI - European Bioinformatics Institute
highlights: Very nice location just outside of Cambridge

highlights: Early exposure to AWS
Rewarding area to provide services in.

work.name: Demenslotsen
work.summary: A guide for informal carers with close ones suffering cognitive disorder.
highlights: Rewarding area to provide services in.
Great to be able to contribute back to the local community using my skill set
